description: Formerly used as pesticide, in the manufacture of dyes and wod preservatives, and as a diet pill. Has been withdrawn from agricultural and dieting use.
Used in production of insecticides, resins, lubricants, and surfactants.
Used in pesticides to trigger hyperpolarization of nerve and muscle cells in invertebrates.
Used in pesticides to control insects on food crops, citrus trees and as a seed treatment in industrial landscaping.
Used primarily in household applications to stop ant infestations.
Used as an insecticide and nematicide for control of soil and foliar pests on a variety of field, fruit and vegetable crops.
Used as an insecticide, acaricide, and miticide to control foliage and soil-borne pests on a variety of crops and industrial settings.
Used as an acetylcholinesterase inhibitor to protect stored grain from pests including weevils, moths, beetles and others.
Used primarily as a household pesticide to control for ants, cockroaches and silverfish. Known to be toxic to fish and invertebrates.
Used as large scale commercial agricultural pesticide as well as in household products. Works as a fast-acting neurotoxin in insects.
Used as a broad-spectrum insecticide around golf courses, gardens, residential lawns and for indoor spot treatment.
Used in agriculture to control soil and foliage insects on a variety of crops. Also used on non-lactating cattle as an insecticidal ear tag.
Used as an insecticide in agriculture (DDT). Currently used in other countries to control mosquitoes.
Used as an insecticide to control a wide range of pests such as moths, flies, beetles, and other insects on vegetable crops.
Used as an insecticide against soil insects like wireworms on food and ornamental crops.
Used widespread as an inexpensive acetylcholinesterase inhibitor to kill pests in agriculture.
Used to control insect pests in agricultural, commercial and domestic situations and external parasites on cattle. Fenthion is also used to control pest birds in and around buildings.
Used to control a wide variety of insects infesting agricultural crops.
Used as an organophosphate insecticide to control mosquitoes and other insects that attack fruits, vegetables, and landscaping plants.
Used as a carbamate insecticide to control foliage and soil-borne insect pests on a variety of food and feed crops. Known to be toxic to humans, livestock, pets, and wildlife.

Used as an insecticide against a wide range of pests including biting flies, houseflies, mosquito larvae, cockroaches, and chiggers. Was commonly used on both agricultural crops and in residual settings.
Used as a pesticide, primarily against mosquitoes. Form of DDT (dichloro-diphenyl-trichloroethane).
Used in pesticides as a syngergist to enhance potency of pyrethroid ingredients.
Used to control a broad spectrum of insects, mites, ticks, and roundworms.
Used as a pesticide for agricultural purposes. Is a metabolite of DDT.
No commercial use but is a metabolite of DDT pesticide.
Used as a fumigant insecticide to control clothes moths.
Used as a broad spectrum, non systemic, synthetic pyrethroid insecticide that targets adults and larvae of biting and chewing pests including scabies and lice.
Used as a synthetic pyrethroid that targets adult fleas and ticks.
Used as a non-systemic, organophosphate acetylcholinesterase inhibitor insecticide primarily on apple trees for control of codling moth.
Used as a pesticide to kill unwanted ferns and nettles. Has additional use as a fungicide in fruit crops. Known androgen receptor antagonist.
Used as an insecticide to control mites on a variety of field, fruit, and vegetable crops, as well as ornamentals.
Used as a pyrethroid insecticide to attack pest nervous systems. Commonly found in household insecticides.
Used as rodenticide in rodent repellant cable coatings and as industrial biocide.
Used as an organophosphate insecticide to control fleas, ticks, flies, lice and insect larvae on livestock and pets. Also used as a perimeter treatment.
Produced primarily by Fusarium fungi and is a prevalent estrogenic mycotoxin found in many cereals and grain based foods. Known ER and GPER agonist.
Used in production of adhesives and sealants, coating products, and polymers.
Used in production of paints and varnishes, and as printing ink resins.
Used as an intermediate, electroplating solvent, washfastening agent, in phenolic resins, and as a developer in thermal paper
Used in production of additives for oils and lubricants, as an intermediate for production of formaldehyde resins, and in paints and resins.
Used in production of detergents, emulsifiers and solubilizers. Additionally used as intermediate for non-ionic surfactants used in pesticides.
Used as plasticizer for cellulose acetate. Additionally, used as intermediate for antioxidants, starches, resins and lubricants.
Used as plasticizer in procesing of polymers in aircraft lubricants and hydraulic fluids. Also used as solvent in bath oils, cologne, nail polish removers, and foundations.
Used as plasticizer for imitation leather, rainware, flooring, childrens toys and more. Also used a inert ingredient in pesticides.
Used in poduction of polycarbonate plastics and is found in windows, plastic bottles, and epoxy resins.
Used as a curing agent in processing of fluorocarbon elastomers.
Used in the manufacture of pneolic resins.
Used in the manufacture of polyvinyl chloride for vinyl flooring.
Used as a plasticizer to make plastics soft and flexible.Â  It is used in nail polishes, shower curtains, raincoats, food wraps, bowls, car interiors, vinyl fabrics, floor tiles, and other products.
Used as a plasticizer to modify the properties of synthetic resins including adhesives and rubber products to increase their stability.
Primarily used as a plasticizer to make plastics more flexible. Also used as a solvent in cosmetics. Some evidence it may have once been used as a pesticide but is not common.
Used to make plastisols for automotive parts and dip-molded products.
Used as a plasticizer.
Putative toxic metabolite of Di-(2-ethylhexyl) phthalate (DEHP - plasticizer). Studies found decreased testicular weight and testicular atrophy in rodents exposed with chronic dosing.
Used as a monomer in the manufacture of polymeric materials.
Used as a wood preservative in the treatment of telephone poles and cross arms.
Used to control grasses, broadleafs, poison ivy, and aquatic weeds.
Used to selectively control annual grasses and broadleaf weeds before they emerge.
Used to inhibit root and shoot development in grasses and other weeds.
Used as herbicide to control weeds in gardens and residential lawns. Known to stop germination, cell wall formation, and root growth.
UsedÊto control germinating and newly emerging grasses and broad-leafed weeds. It is applied to agricultural crops, ornamental bulbs, and poplar trees for use in shelterbelts in the mid-west.
Used as a broad spectrum herbicide for general weed control in many agricultural crops and in residential settings.
Used to selectively control certain broadleef weeds and grassy weed species on a wide range of crops.
Used as a bleaching herbicide to selectively control germinating annual grasses and broadleaf weeds in crops. Works by interfering with the carotenoid biosynthetic pathway.
Used as a benzamide herbicide for controlling weeds in lettuce, soybeans, cotton, and other crops.
Used as a preemergence herbicide to provide broad-spectrum control of a wide range of annual and perennial grasses and broadleaf weeds.
Used as a preemergence herbicide on grass to control broadleaf weeds.
Used in household and agricultural applications to prevent and control fungi-associated diseases of plants.
Used to control soil-borne plant diseases and as a casting worm control agent in turf environments.
Used as a broad spectrum nonsystemic fungicide to control mold, mildew, bacteria and algae.
Used to act against rusts, blackspot and mildew fungi. Used primarily on ornamental plants and lawns, but also used on tomatoes, peppers and melons.
Used as a foliar fungicide for the control of Typhula on barley and sheath blight on rice, as well as a seed dressing for other crops.
Used as an agricultural fungicide to control mildew, leaf spot, and other crop diseases.
Used as a contact fungicide to block the growth of the fungal mycelium and to inhibit the germination of fungal spores.
Used as a systemic fungicide to control plant diseases caused by oomycetes or water-mold fungi. Used on both food crops and residental shrubbery.
Used as a seed dressing or soil treatment to control a wide range of fungi in agricultural settings.
Used as an imidazole fungicide primarily on turfgasses grown for aesthetics or athletic purposes. Additionally used on some food crops and in gardens.

Used agriculturally as a systemic fungicide on turfgrasses grown for seed and aesthetic or athletic value, wheat, mushrooms, corn, wild rice, peanuts, almonds, sorghum, oats, pecans, apricots, peaches, nectarines, plums, prunes and lemons.
Used as a triazole fungicide to deliver both curative and preventative control of diseases plants.
Used to control various fungal diseases in fruit and evergreen ornamental trees.
Used as a fungicide primarily in the wine industry but also on other fruit crops and on crops. Known androgen antagonist.
Estrogen and 5alpha-reductase inhibitor used to topically treat androgenic alopecia or pattern baldness.
Estrogen used in birth control in combination with progestins.
Endogenous estrogen sex hormone. Used in menopausal hormone therapy, treatment of low female sex hormones, and transgender hormone therapy.
Androgen formerly marketted for veterinary use of increasing muscle mass and mineral absorption in cattle. Now commonly used as black market anabolic steroid.
Androgen used in treatment of low testosterone in men, delayed puberty in boys, menopausal symptoms in women, and some breast cancers.
Androgen used as dietary supplement and anabolic steroid. Was commonly used in sports but sale was banned in 2004 by FDA.
Endogenous androgen sex hormone. Used in treatment of low testosterone in men and as anabolic steroid.
Used as topical gel for the treatment of breast hyperplasia (SERM).
Used in treatment of early hormone receptor-positive breast cancer and in hormone receptor-unknown advanced or metastatic breast cancer.
Naturally found in plants and used as food supplement to induce muscle relaxtion, sedation, and decrease anxiety. Also investigated for use in cancer and Alzhiemer treatment.
Anti-androgen used to treat metastatic prostate cancer.
Used to induced ovulation in women who do not produce ova but wish to become pregnant.
Endogenous pituitary adrenocortical hormone. Occosionally used along silimar corticosteroids to treat rheumatologic diseases, reduce inflammation, or suppress the immune system.
Is a naturally occuring phytoestrogen that has been shown to inhibit aromatase activity and has been investigated in supplement to hormone therapy and chemotherapy in breast cancer patients.
Anti-androgen used to suppress testosterone (and DHT) from acting on tissues. Has been used in the treatment of prostate cancer.
Is a naturally occuring isoflavone found in soybeans and other legumes. Has been shown to be useful for menopausal relief, osteoporosis, and lowering the risk of some hormone-related cancers.
Androgen used primarily to treat endometriosis and fibrocysic breast disease. Known estrogen antagonist.
Used primarily in the 1900's to prevent miscarriages and pregnancy complications. Is a synthetic form of estrogen.
Non-steroidal ER antagonist that is used to raise serum total testosterone levels while maintaining sperm counts in men with secondary hypogonadism.

Estrogenic steroid produced by horses. Used for the treatment of menopause symptoms, atrophic vaginitis, osteoporosis, hypoestrogenism, castration, primary ovarian failure, breast cancer (for palliation only), and Advanced androgen-dependent carcinoma of the prostate (for palliation only).
Endogenous minor female sex hormone. Used as drug in menopausal hormone therapy.
Anti-estrogen used as an aromatase inhibitor to treat forms of breast cancer.
Anti-androgen used to treat hair loss and benign prostatic hyperplasia in men. Functions as a 5alpha-reductase inhibitor.
Anti-androgen used primarily to treat prostate cancer and other androgen-dependent tumors.
Used as an aromatase inhibitor to reduce plasma estrogen levels in the treatment of postmenopausal women with breast cancer.

Used as estrogen receptor antagonist to block action of estrogen on cancer cells in patients with hormone-receptor positive breast cancer. Works to destabilize the receptor, causing normal degredation processes to destroy it.
Naturally found in plants and known to exibit estrogen agonist activity (phytoestrogen), particularly in Erbeta. Some evidence of use in treating prostate cancer.
Anti-androgen used primarily to treat prostate cancer and other androgen-dependent tumors. More common to use parent Flutamide due to 2OH-Flut short half life (6 hours).
Used as a progestin hormone to help pregnant women lower the risk of premature birth.
Naturally found in plant-derived foods, and used as a food supplement for antioxidant properties and to reduce inflammation.
Used as an aromatase inhibitor to reduce plasma estrogen levels in the treatment of postmenopausal women with hormone-dependent breast cancer.
Used as a progestin in birth control to prevent the development and release of a woman's egg each month.
Used as a synthetic estrogen in oral birth control to prevent ovulation and pregnancy.
Used as a progesterone blocker to prevent continuancy of pregnancy in early stages.
Used as a falvonoid for anti-inflammatory properties. Additionally, studies suggest beneficial for treatment of obesity, diabetes, and hypertension.
Anti-androgen used to treat metastatic prostate cancer by blocking effects of testosterone.
Used as a form of progesterone in birth controls to stop the lining of the uterus from growing. Additionally used to prevent pregnancy and to treat some menstrual disorders.
Used as a selective estrogen receptor modulator (SERM) to prevent and treat thinning of bones in postmenopausal women. Works like an estrogen to stop bone loss.

Used to treat conditions in hich the body is producing too much aldosterone (functions as anti-androgen). Particular uses including treatment of high blood pressure, prevention fo heart attacks and as a potassium-sparing diuretic.
Used as a selective estrogen receptor modulator (SERM) to treat all stages of hormone-receptor positive breast cancer.
Androgen used as an androgen and anabolic steroid for the treatment of low testosterone in men. Also has use in the treatment of breast cancer in women.
Used as UV-absorber to protect against degredation in cosmetics, plastics, and automative parts.
Used as UV-absorber in cosmetic and fragrance polymers, as a sunscreening agent, and UV stabilizer for paint polymers.
Used as additive in cosmetics and fragrence agents.
Used in preparation of parabens, commonly used as preservatives in cosmetics.
Used primarily as an antimicrobial preservative in cosmetics. Also used as a flavor additive in food.
Used as an antimicrobial preservative in cosmetics and various other personal items like sunscreen. Used in some cleaning products, adhesives and in solutions for childrens bubble machines.
